tool.name: AddLinearLineOfSightFields

param.name: Input_Observer_Features
param.dialogReference: The Observer point features to which to add the height field. Select a layer from the map, or browse to a feature class.
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

param.name: Observer_Height_Above_Surface
param.dialogReference: The height value to add for each Observer point feature.
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

param.name: Input_Target_Features
param.dialogReference: The Target point features to which to add height field. Select a layer from the map, or browse to a feature class.
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

param.name: Target_Height_Above_Surface
param.dialogReference: The height value to add for each Target point feature.
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

tool.summary: Adds height field to observer and target point features classes before they are used to run Linear Line of Sight (LLOS).
tool.usage:
Usage

  • Run this tool on Observer, and Target features before running Linear Line of Sight (LLOS).

  • Adds a new field named height, and calculates a default value for all rows in the Input Observer Features and Input Target Features.

  • The units of the height will be the elevation units of the surface against which LLOS will run. If the surface elevation is in METERS, these values are METERS. If the surface is in FEET, these values are FEET.

  • Default height for Observers is 2.

  • Default height for Targets is 0.

scriptExample.title: There are no code samples for this tool.
